replies.body: It's also a month away from the day I was born

Careful with that, if anybody finds this and also finds out how old you are they could guess your full birthdate and piece that together with any other information they might be gathering to try to steal your accounts or other things.

Well I guess one of the very few benefits of living on the poverty line means I have nothing anyone would want to steal...

{{sticker:sg-janna}}
Quite true assertion :<

\#sadbuttrueface

T_T

I read that as,

"Sad Butt Rue Face"

~~Found what I was looking for. 'Putting on that laughing face, but really crying on the inside.'~~

~~Edit: I realize that emoji has two different use cases, I'm not referring to the one of 'laughing so hard you cry.'~~

<image removed>

_EDIT: After some discussion I believe I was mistaken, so I've removed the content as it was not relevant._
I didn't know it was ever used to mean laughing on the outside, crying on the inside.  I've only ever seen it used for laughing to the point of crying.
Perhaps I was mistaken then, my apologies.
No need for apologies.  I was simply observing that I myself had not come across that usage.

It's similar to usage of the acronym "k ys" if it's consistently thought of in one way, it shouldn't be used in another way because that can cause confusion and lead people to think you meant the common meaning.

A kind of extreme example, I'll admit, but relevant nonetheless. I've edited the comment since it could have potentially been mistaken as making fun of people living near the poverty line.

tldr; I made the edits for two reasons:

1. It could have been considered offensive
2. to remain consistent with my own values about intent vs conventional meaning
Oh I see what you mean.
Thanks for the reassurance lol.

> [{quoted}](name=3SheetsTotheWind,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=L6VTiv04,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2017-10-03T19:27:58.871+0000)
>
> Well I guess one of the very few benefits of living on the poverty line means I have nothing anyone would want to steal...
> 
> {{sticker:sg-janna}}

maybe they want to steal your rp?

I highly doubt that.  Let's do some maths.

Life expectancy = 79 years = 28,855 days

Population of North America = 485 million

485000000/28855 = 16808 people who share a birthday with you on average.  This is likely higher for people under the age of 40 because people die more frequently as they age so there are more people who are younger.

You also have to take into account that he never actually said in which direction his birthday is a month away. It's most likely that he meant a month in the future, but it could be a month in the past.

 Also, assuming that it's in the future, that puts his birthday in November - fully 9 months after February. And what is so significant about February? Valentines Day. There's probably a larger percentage of birthdays in November than in most other months.
Today is the day I was born.
